intro: Pterolophus pinnatifidus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed pterolophus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found growing in rocky soils and along dry riverbeds. Due to its hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated as an ornamental plant in regions with similar climatic conditions.
